Technique: DOVETAIL (JOINT); WRITTEN WITH A REED PEN/REED WITH SPLIT NIB
Name: Greek papyrus
Description: This fragment of Greek papyrus containing parts of three colunmns of text comes from the town of Oxyrhynchus (P. Oxy VI 878). This is a piece of Book II (22.3-25.3) of the Athenian historian Thucydides.The papyrus has been written by a professional scribe, but the text is of average quality seeing several rare reading signs.
